Title: Data Scientist (Junior)
Description:
We are growing our data science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What you will do

Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations

Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data

Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.

Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets

Present information using data visualization techniques

What we are looking for

Scientific background with computational and analytical skills

Strong problem-solving skills

Programming skills with Python and SQL

Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)

Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)

Experience with data visualization tools and packages

A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

~1 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications

Experience working with huge amounts of data

Experience with cloud based web services (e.g., AWS)

Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).

Why Tendam

One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members

Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.

Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!

Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!

Exposure to agile methodologies

Working with senior Data Scientists to accelerate your professional development

Working in a challenging and dynamic industry




Ubicaci√≥n oficinas: Madrid Capital zona Norte accesible en transporte p√∫blico (metro, cercan√≠as-Renfe y autobuses urbanos e interubanos).

Horario jornada flexible: de lunes a jueves entrada entre las 7:30 y las 9:30h y salida entre las 17h y las 19h, viernes jornada intensiva y flexibleentrada entre las 7:30 y las 9:30h y salida entre las 13h y las 15h.

Contrato indefinido.

Salario de fijo + variable

Incorporaci√≥n inmediata (entendiendo que si la persona seleccionada est√° actualmente trabajando en otra empresa, tendr√° que dar el preaviso correspondiente y se coordinar√° una fecha entre ambas partes que pueda cuadrar).

Title: Python - Desarrollador de back-end
Description:

En dezzai lideramos el presente y futuro de la Inteligencia Artificial combinando tecnolog√≠a de vanguardia, creatividad e innovaci√≥n para resolver los desaf√≠os en el mundo empresarial.

¬øQu√© pedimos?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - AI Inteligencia Artificial
Description:
The Digital Business Team develops promising digital solutions for global products and processes. It aims to organize Applus+ Laboratories' information, making it useful, fast, and reliable for both the Applus+ Group and its clients. The team‚Äôs mission is to be recognized as the most digital, innovative, and customer-oriented company, reducing digital operations' costs while increasing the value and portfolio of services.




We are looking for a Data Science / AI Engineer to join our Digital team and contribute to the development of evolving data products and applications.




What are we are looking for?

Collect, organize, and analyze information to generate code, train models, verify and validate outputs, and draw meaningful conclusions.
Have strong mathematical fundamentals and be proficient in numerical and statistical methods, as well as a variety of machine learning algorithms.
Bring expertise in NLP and foundation models, with specific knowledge in transformers, tokenization, and encoding-decoding processes.
Apply Explainable AI methodologies and use related Python libraries (e.g., SHAP, LIME).
Demonstrate organized thinking, strong logic and reasoning skills, and effective communication, ensuring knowledge sharing through documentation and well-commented code.
Possess a keen eye for detail to identify anomalies in data and code.
Exhibit creativity and an "out-of-the-box" approach to problem-solving.




Requirements:

Demonstrated experience coding in python specifically working in data science projects and using ML most common libraries.
2+ year experience in ML / AI projects.
Strong knowledge in machine learning / deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Specific knowledge on Computer Linguistics may be an advantage: NLP libraries like Spacy or NLTK, genAI frameworks such as LangChain and/or LlamaIndex, chunking, tokenization, embeddings...
Specific expertness on foundation models will be considered.
Previous experiences working with Generative AI and explainable AI are welcome.




Our current tech stack is:

Python
Commonly used ML/AI libraries
Azure AI
Java




Technical Requirements

Proven coding experience (e.g., Python; other languages are a plus) in data science projects and familiarity with common ML libraries.
Hands-on experience in ML/AI projects (preferred).
Solid knowledge of data mining, machine learning, and deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Familiarity with computer linguistics: NLP libraries (e.g., SpaCy, NLTK), generative AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex), tokenization, embeddings, and chunking.
Expertise in foundation models and previous work with Generative AI and Explainable AI is an advantage.

Education

Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
A master‚Äôs degree in Data Science or AI Engineering is an advantage.

Languages

Fluent in Spanish and English.




If you are passionate about neural networks, advanced AI algorithms, and challenging yourself, this is the right job for you!

Title: Research Executive (PromoCar)
Description:
This position will be part of the promoCAR team. It is an international team with English, French and Spanish spoken daily. English represents the official language used for the communication with our partners and clients. You will have the opportunity to work with the Client Service team.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for people who enjoy focusing on detailed information, with a strong focus on collaboration and willingness to continuously develop their skills and knowledge. Experience in working with large amounts of data (collecting, processing, and analyzing). Analytical skills, resourcefulness and a data-driven mentality are required to elicit additional, relevant information and ensure the data obtained is of the highest quality.

Excellent computer skills, including advanced knowledge of Excel, as much of the work will entail working with spreadsheets and data manipulation. Be able to prioritize workloads and respond to tight deadlines, demonstrating a logical and methodical approach to problem.

Ideal candidate is insightful, strong academic background, a willingness to take on responsibility, and a keen interest in market research, marketing, technology, and general business. Finally, what we value the most is the ability and interest to learn and develop professionally.

Interest and/or work experience in the automotive sector is preferred.

SKILLS REQUIRED:

- Fluent in Spanish, English (required) and French

- Perfect knowledge of MS Office, especially Power Point, Excel, Word.

- Accurate, organized and with analytical skills

- Knowledge about Automotive

YOUR DUTIES:

Your responsibilities will mainly be focused on:

Provide accurate and timely research of automotive financial data available in the market to ensure a steady flow of the highest quality data by using effective networking (internal, external, primary or secondary sources) and influencing skills.
Monitor marketing strategies of automotive market(s) and collect the relevant and required data to then input into promoCAR‚Äôs proprietary software following company procedures and guidelines.
Track automotive financial market trends for retail and business customers.
Ensure the database is kept up to date using promoCAR proprietary software, as well as ensuring relevant quality standards, procedures, and business requirements are met
Perform quality assurance activities and implement corrections and changes into the database.
Successfully resolve customer enquiries as part of promoCAR‚Äôs client service experience; customer support/escalation process
Work with other areas/regions to ensure data is consistently available throughout all the markets.
Implement corrections and changes into the database as guided and required by the Data Operations management.

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.




At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.







Primary Responsibilities




Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time zones




Qualifications




BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years working with Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent interpersonal communication skills ‚Äì especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

Title: Junior Data Scientist 1
Description:
Mission

If You Have a Passion For Data And Technology And Want To Join a Crew Of Sharp Analytical Minds, Then This May Be The Right Opportunity For You. As a Junior Data Scientist, You Will Get a Chance To Take Part On The Typical Tasks Our Data Scientists Do On a Daily Basis


Translate business needs to technical requirements
Define strategy for use of data and how data use interacts with data design
Create and document reusable packages and libraries in Python and other languages
Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources
Develop, train, finetune and industrialize ML models
Implement and hands-off data checking and updating procedures to other teams
Be a member of an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products
Develop end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications


Your profile


Until 2 years of experience in data science
Experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL)
Experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)
Experience performing ETL functions and understanding data quality steps
Strong in quantitative analysis, statistics, or mathematics
Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience
Ability to work in a fast pace and learn quickly
(Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning
(Bonus) Experience with regression modeling, forecasting, and/ or time series analysis
(Bonus) Experience with NLP
(Bonus) Experience with visualization tools (Shiny, Power BI, Tableau)
(Bonus) AWS Cloud/Azure experience/exposure


Who are we?

Are you ready to take part in the upcoming AI revolution of the business world? If the answer is a resounding "yes," we have an extraordinary offer for you!

Aily Labs, founded in 2020, is an exciting and rapidly growing startup based in Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, New York and Cluj. With a team consisting of over 300+ passionate and skilled ML Engineers, Data Scientists and Developers, we are dedicated to our ambitious objective of democratizing AI.‚ÄØ

We have harnessed cutting-edge technology to develop an exceptional AI mobile app that goes beyond conventional solutions. By seamlessly providing immediate business insights, we are poised to revolutionise the corporate landscape.

Our vision is to establish ourselves as the preferred platform for AI-driven decision-making, setting new standards in the industry.‚ÄØWe firmly believe that our state-of-the-art technology empowers organisations to make faster and more intelligent choices.

By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of this transformative movement, shaping the future of intelligent decision-making in remarkable ways.

What sets us apart?


We are an internationally diverse and young team with more than 30 nationalities.
We develop high-quality, beautiful software and thus create sustainable added value for our customers.
We pay competitive salaries and reward performance
We live an open feedback culture so that we can constantly reflect and improve.
We offer flexible remote work with free time management within the projects.
We enjoy new technologies, are open for innovative ideas and foster trial and error principles.
We give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us.
We do cool and fun offsites (e.g. Ibiza. Kitzb√ºhel), and regular casual get-togethers.


About Us

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job description: The Opportunity

¬†

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Consultant to join our Order to Cash Business Process Expert Team.¬†

Mission:¬†He/she will help to maximize the performance of the organization through the implementation of processes for improving data quality as well as reporting and analytics tools and processes in Order to Cash. This will include analyzing user and data requirements, and procedures and problems to automate or improve data flows and systems. It will also include reviewing existing system and data capabilities, and workflow and process limitations.

What you'll get to do

¬†Responsibilities:¬†

Analyze, validate and document reporting and analytics business requirements, processes and business rules to drive business solutions.
Support technology design and re-design activities through interpretation and clarification of business requirements and processes and assess impacts of changes to other functional processes and systems.
Lead and/or assist with the creation of business cases, ROIs, and other project related documentation, as required, with input from key business stakeholders
Investigate and analyze opportunities to help improve data quality and business and reporting and analytics applications.
Coordinate, support and help business users resolve day-to-day support issues including data, application software and operational systems.
Assist and support project teams and business representatives throughout projects
Manage projects or processes with limited oversight.

¬†

We'd love to meet you if you have

¬†

Experience and Qualifications¬†

Successfully completed degree in Data Science, Information technology, Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
Experience as a data analyst in the use of process mining tools will be a plus.
Very good communication skills.
Must also have excellent computer skills in the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports, for departmental heads/management, senior data analytics management, and key stakeholders.
Structured, accurate and responsible way of working.
Analytical and solution-oriented thinking skills.
Excellent English skills.

¬†

A few things you'll love about us
An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
A range of learning and development opportunities
An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
A competitive compensation & benefits package

HTML:
Job description: The Opportunity

 

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Consultant to join our Order to Cash Business Process Expert Team. 

Mission: He/she will help to maximize the performance of the organization through the implementation of processes for improving data quality as well as reporting and analytics tools and processes in Order to Cash. This will include analyzing user and data requirements, and procedures and problems to automate or improve data flows and systems. It will also include reviewing existing system and data capabilities, and workflow and process limitations.

What you'll get to do

 Responsibilities: 

  • Analyze, validate and document reporting and analytics business requirements, processes and business rules to drive business solutions.
  • Support technology design and re-design activities through interpretation and clarification of business requirements and processes and assess impacts of changes to other functional processes and systems.
  • Lead and/or assist with the creation of business cases, ROIs, and other project related documentation, as required, with input from key business stakeholders
  • Investigate and analyze opportunities to help improve data quality and business and reporting and analytics applications.
  • Coordinate, support and help business users resolve day-to-day support issues including data, application software and operational systems.
  • Assist and support project teams and business representatives throughout projects
  • Manage projects or processes with limited oversight.

 

We'd love to meet you if you have

 

Experience and Qualifications 

  • Successfully completed degree in Data Science, Information technology, Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
  • Experience as a data analyst in the use of process mining tools will be a plus.
  • Very good communication skills.
  • Must also have excellent computer skills in the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports, for departmental heads/management, senior data analytics management, and key stakeholders.
  • Structured, accurate and responsible way of working.
  • Analytical and solution-oriented thinking skills.
  • Excellent English skills.

 

A few things you'll love about us
  • An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
  • A range of learning and development opportunities
  • An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
  • A competitive compensation & benefits package

Title: Data Scientist ‚Äì AI & ML Engineering
Description:
Idealista leads real estate online marketplaces in Spain, Italy, and Portugal. Our Data Crew, a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, engineers, and platform experts, is shaping the future of real estate by delivering scalable, data-driven solutions that help millions of users find their dream homes.

About the Role

We‚Äôre seeking an Experienced Data Scientist to lead the development and evolution of end-to-end data products with a strong foundation on AI and ML solutions. You‚Äôll tackle real business challenges, from optimizing internal operations to enhancing customer-facing features, while collaborating with stakeholders to design impactful solutions. Working alongside skilled engineers and fellow Data Scientists, you‚Äôll deploy scalable, automated products that deliver measurable value.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Experience: Proven track record of at least three end-to-end ML/AI projects successfully deployed into production, demonstrating measurable impact and scalability.
Core Skills:
Advanced proficiency in Python with strong applied experience in ML & AI.
Deep Learning (NLP & Computer Vision): Experience fine-tuning LLMs, training image-based models and working with transformers and other traditional architectures (CNNs, RNNs).
Strong foundation in statistics, machine learning, and deep learning.
Experience deploying ML models via APIs (e.g., BentoML, FastAPI, DVC) and integrating into production systems
Hands-on experience with MLOps tools (e.g., MLFlow, DVC, Docker).
Problem-Solving: Ability to translate business problems into effective data solutions.
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to explain both technical and business concepts.
Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with evolving tools and processes.

Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience with low level Pytorch/Tensorflow implementation of Deep Learning architectures
Experience with prompt optimization using frameworks such as DSPY
Familiarity with anti-fraud systems to ensure platform integrity, knowledge on search engines or expertise in online marketplace dynamics.

What You‚Äôll Do

Collaborate with business stakeholders to deeply understand their challenges and design data-driven solutions that directly address key business objectives.
Query and prepare data from our extensive data lake, leveraging SQL and other tools to create high-quality datasets.
Co-lead the design of data annotation initiatives with Product Managers to ensure high-quality, labeled datasets that drive the development of robust, data-centric machine learning solutions.
Develop and deploy machine learning models and analytics pipelines that scale effectively.
Work with engineers to ensure robust deployment and automation of solutions using tools like dbt, dvc, Airflow, BentoML and MLFlow.
Apply KISS principles to design simple, impactful solutions that prioritize reliability and maintainability.
Proactively identify new opportunities for data-driven improvements and prototype innovative solutions.

What We Expect from You

In the First Month:

Meet the Data Crew and key stakeholders to understand idealista‚Äôs ecosystem and the project you will be working on.
Review existing documentation, gain hands-on experience with tools, and contribute to a project in production.
Refine onboarding documentation with your insights.

In Three Months:

Maintain and enhance existing AI/ML solutions and start designing a new solution.
Build strong relationships with team leaders and master our data platform.
Collaborate with backend & MLOps teams to integrate scalable models into production.
Document metrics and methods to enhance team workflows.

In Six Months:

Deliver a fully automated, documented data product in production.
Establish trust with Product Managers and integrate advanced analytics solutions into product features.
Share knowledge through internal talks.

In Twelve Months:

Lead impactful projects that influence company-wide performance indicators.
Be a key player in shaping data science strategies at idealista.
Mentor junior colleagues and contribute to their professional growth.

Our Philosophy

We value simplicity, clarity, and business impact. As business-first data scientists, we aim to solve complex challenges using simple, effective tools and techniques. Machine learning and advanced AI are applied only when they deliver clear value, ensuring our solutions remain practical and robust. By constantly refining our approach, we stay ahead of the curve in delivering innovative solutions.

Strong writing culture: We believe in reducing meetings to the minimum, which requires strong writing skills to document ideas, share knowledge, and ensure alignment across teams.
Proactivity: We expect our team members to actively engage with peers, share updates, seek feedback, and collaborate to drive continuous improvement across data initiatives.

If you enjoy simplifying complexity, taking ownership of your work, and creating solutions that matter, you‚Äôll thrive in our team.

What We Offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible work options (remote or hybrid with opportunities to visit our Madrid office).
Learning and development opportunities to support your career growth.
Belong to a high-performing team of Data Scientists in a collaborative, innovation-driven culture where your ideas are valued and your work has a real-world impact.

Title: BUSINESS DEVELOPER
Description:
YSIUM MEDICAL, an innovative and fast-growing company in the healthcare sector, is seeking a BUSINESS DEVELOPER to join the team. The position is based near Pamplona, with flexibility for candidates based in cities such as Madrid or Barcelona.




Contribute to the business strategy and the evolution of the company‚Äôs business model, implementing actions to enhance scalability.
Support the financial and economic planning, including budget control, forecasting, and profitability analysis of projects and the company.
Lead, alongside the executive team, investment processes, participating in funding rounds

Develop and maintain strategic relationships with key stakeholders, clients, and investors.
Coordinate with internal teams to align the commercial strategy with the company‚Äôs financial objectives.




Company: Ysium Medical - Innovation in Medical Devices

Related News: Navarra Capital - New Investors in Ysium Medical




We welcome applications from professionals looking to be part of a high-growth project, with a strong customer and results orientation, initiative, and excellent communication skills. Candidates with a global business vision and ambition for international growth will be highly valued.




Mandatory: Degree in Business Administration, Health Sciences, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree in Healthcare Management, Commercial Management, or similar will be a plus.
Mandatory: Minimum 3-4 years of experience in business development, sales, or commercial management in the healthcare sector or technology transfer.
Mandatory: Advanced English level (C1)
Availability to travel. Possibility to reside outside Pamplona, in cities like Madrid or Barcelona.




We offer an attractive incentive plan and the possibility of advancing towards C-level positions in the future, within a dynamic and innovative environment in the healthcare sector.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Data Scientist (AI & Workplace Automation)




Location: Madrid

Job Type: [Full-time/Contract]

Experience Level: + 5 years




About the Role

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist to develop AI/ML models that enhance workplace automation, efficiency, and decision-making. You will play a key role in ensuring our AI solutions are accurate, explainable, and aligned with business needs.




Key Responsibilities

Develop predictive models to analyze employee behavior and productivity
Create data-driven strategies to improve digital workplace efficiency
Fine-tune AI models for query understanding, summarization, and knowledge retrieval
Analyze workplace data to identify trends and automation opportunities
Ensure AI models are ethical, explainable, and aligned with real-world applications




Requirements

Strong experience in machine learning, deep learning, and data science
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn)
Experience with NLP, predictive modeling, and data-driven decision-making
Ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights
Strong problem-solving skills and a business-oriented mindset
Microsoft Copilot
Fluency in English and Spanish




Nice to Have

Experience with digital workplace automation and HR analytics
Knowledge of MLOps, cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Understanding of AI ethics and explainability




Why Join Us?

Work on cutting-edge AI projects that drive real business impact

Collaborative and innovative work environment

Career growth opportunities in AI & workplace automation




Ready to apply? Send your CV to j.sierra@asenium.com

Title: DATA SCIENTIST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER - Energy and Food
Description:
EURECAT

Eurecat is the main Research & Technology Organisation in Catalonia and the second largest private research organization in southern Europe. It brings together the experience of more than 700 professionals and provides services to more than 2,000 companies. Applied R&D, technological services, highly specialized training, technological consultancy or valorisation and exploitation of industrial property are some of the services that Eurecat offers for both large and small and medium-sized enterprises in all sectors. The technology centre participates in more than 200 large national and international consortium projects of high strategic R&I and has 181 patents and 10 spin-offs. The added value provided by Eurecat accelerates innovation, reduces spending on scientific and technological infrastructures, reduces risks and provides specialized knowledge tailored to each company.

Job Description

Are you ready to embark on a challenging journey of discovering and applying novel Machine Learning and AI-driven solutions in trending topics including energy optimization in microgrids with renewable energies and electric vehicle, interoperable digital twins for advanced monitoring and management of assets or novel technologies to contribute to better practices in the agricultural sector?

The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of EURECAT is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist and Machine Learning engineer to help us pave the way in digitalization and development of new technologies for creating a smarter and more sustainable future.

Responsabilities

As a valued member of our team, your role encompasses several critical dimensions:


Design and implement solutions based on mathematical algorithms and classical ML: supervised and unsupervised models, regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, optimization, recommendation systems, time series, semi-supervised learning, etc.
Design and implement solutions based on Deep Learning techniques like Recurrent Neural Networks and Autoencoders.
Research innovative techniques and methods in the field of artificial intelligence to stay up-to-date with new trends.
Practical application and experimentation of state-of-the-art techniques in projects and challenges to be developed.
Global Impact: Collaborate on scientific publications, sharing your insights with the wider research community.
Tailored Growth: We recognize your unique strengths and interests. Your responsibilities will evolve accordingly, fostering personalized development within our team.
Project Leadership: As you grow and the projects unfold, your adept project management skills will steer us toward success.


WHAT EURECAT CAN OFFER YOU?

Our Group Is Specialized In Applied Research And Development On ML And AI Solutions. The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit Of Eurecat Develops Innovative Solutions (algorithms, Methods, Platforms) Based On a Combination Of Artificial Intelligence And Knowledge Management Technologies, Especially For The Industrial, Energy And Sustainability Sectors. We Have Over 12 Years Of Experience Pushing The Adoption Of State-of-the-art AI And ML Solutions For Our Private Customers As Well As For Relevant European Research Projects! Check Out Our Portfolio

Applied Artificial Intelligence - Eurecat (applied-artificial-intelligence-eurecat.github.io)

Applied Artificial Intelligence Eurecat Technological Centre

And ‚Ä¶


Permanent contract
Hybrid work (3 home office/2 work in the office)
Flexible Schedule
Shorter workday on Friday and Summer Schedule
Flexible remuneration package (health insurance, transport, lunch, studies - training and kindergarten)
Eurecat workers can join the Eurecat Academy courses
Eurecat workers can attend to our weekly thematic sessions to be aware of Eurecat areas of knowledge.
Language‚Äôs training (English, Catalan and Spanish)


Please note that interviews for the selection process will continue in September.

Requirements


Passion for DataScience and ML.
Basic studies: Physics, Math, Energy engineering, Agronomy, Forestry engineering.
Superior studies: MSc or equivalent in ML, AI, Computer Vision, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, with a track record of applying AI techniques.
Proficiency in Python and knowledge of basic libraries like Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, SciPy.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization and its implementation in python with libraries like Pyomo or PuLP.
Valuable knowledge in some deep learning libraries like Keras, PyTorch and Tensorflow.
Open minded and multidisciplinary: Eager to learn new domains.
Dynamic communication skills, allowing you to effectively convey complex ideas and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
A readiness to travel when needed, embracing opportunities to connect with clients, partners, and collaborators worldwide.
Languages: English, Catalan, Spanish

Job Description

Are you ready to embark on a challenging journey of discovering and applying novel Machine Learning and AI-driven solutions in trending topics including energy optimization in microgrids with renewable energies and electric vehicle, interoperable digital twins for advanced monitoring and management of assets or novel technologies to contribute to better practices in the agricultural sector?

The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of EURECAT is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist and Machine Learning engineer to help us pave the way in digitalization and development of new technologies for creating a smarter and more sustainable future.

Responsabilities

As a valued member of our team, your role encompasses several critical dimensions:

  • Design and implement solutions based on mathematical algorithms and classical ML: supervised and unsupervised models, regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, optimization, recommendation systems, time series, semi-supervised learning, etc.
  • Design and implement solutions based on Deep Learning techniques like Recurrent Neural Networks and Autoencoders.
  • Research innovative techniques and methods in the field of artificial intelligence to stay up-to-date with new trends.
  • Practical application and experimentation of state-of-the-art techniques in projects and challenges to be developed.
  • Global Impact: Collaborate on scientific publications, sharing your insights with the wider research community.
  • Tailored Growth: We recognize your unique strengths and interests. Your responsibilities will evolve accordingly, fostering personalized development within our team.
  • Project Leadership: As you grow and the projects unfold, your adept project management skills will steer us toward success.

WHAT EURECAT CAN OFFER YOU?

Our Group Is Specialized In Applied Research And Development On ML And AI Solutions. The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit Of Eurecat Develops Innovative Solutions (algorithms, Methods, Platforms) Based On a Combination Of Artificial Intelligence And Knowledge Management Technologies, Especially For The Industrial, Energy And Sustainability Sectors. We Have Over 12 Years Of Experience Pushing The Adoption Of State-of-the-art AI And ML Solutions For Our Private Customers As Well As For Relevant European Research Projects! Check Out Our Portfolio

Applied Artificial Intelligence - Eurecat (applied-artificial-intelligence-eurecat.github.io)

Applied Artificial Intelligence Eurecat Technological Centre

And ‚Ä¶

  • Permanent contract
  • Hybrid work (3 home office/2 work in the office)
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Shorter workday on Friday and Summer Schedule
  • Flexible remuneration package (health insurance, transport, lunch, studies - training and kindergarten)
  • Eurecat workers can join the Eurecat Academy courses
  • Eurecat workers can attend to our weekly thematic sessions to be aware of Eurecat areas of knowledge.
  • Language‚Äôs training (English, Catalan and Spanish)

Please note that interviews for the selection process will continue in September.

Requirements

  • Passion for DataScience and ML.
  • Basic studies: Physics, Math, Energy engineering, Agronomy, Forestry engineering.
  • Superior studies: MSc or equivalent in ML, AI, Computer Vision, or a related field.
  • Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, with a track record of applying AI techniques.
  • Proficiency in Python and knowledge of basic libraries like Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, SciPy.
  • Knowledge of mathematical optimization and its implementation in python with libraries like Pyomo or PuLP.
  • Valuable knowledge in some deep learning libraries like Keras, PyTorch and Tensorflow.
  • Open minded and multidisciplinary: Eager to learn new domains.
  • Dynamic communication skills, allowing you to effectively convey complex ideas and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
  • A readiness to travel when needed, embracing opportunities to connect with clients, partners, and collaborators worldwide.
  • Languages: English, Catalan, Spanish

Title: Junior Data Scientist 1
Description:
Mission

If You Have a Passion For Data And Technology And Want To Join a Crew Of Sharp Analytical Minds, Then This May Be The Right Opportunity For You. As a Junior Data Scientist, You Will Get a Chance To Take Part On The Typical Tasks Our Data Scientists Do On a Daily Basis


Translate business needs to technical requirements
Define strategy for use of data and how data use interacts with data design
Create and document reusable packages and libraries in Python and other languages
Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources
Develop, train, finetune and industrialize ML models
Implement and hands-off data checking and updating procedures to other teams
Be a member of an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products
Develop end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications


Your profile


Until 2 years of experience in data science
Experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL)
Experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)
Experience performing ETL functions and understanding data quality steps
Strong in quantitative analysis, statistics, or mathematics
Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience
Ability to work in a fast pace and learn quickly
(Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning
(Bonus) Experience with regression modeling, forecasting, and/ or time series analysis
(Bonus) Experience with NLP
(Bonus) Experience with visualization tools (Shiny, Power BI, Tableau)
(Bonus) AWS Cloud/Azure experience/exposure


Who are we?

Are you ready to take part in the upcoming AI revolution of the business world? If the answer is a resounding "yes," we have an extraordinary offer for you!

Aily Labs, founded in 2020, is an exciting and rapidly growing startup based in Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, New York and Cluj. With a team consisting of over 300+ passionate and skilled ML Engineers, Data Scientists and Developers, we are dedicated to our ambitious objective of democratizing AI.‚ÄØ

We have harnessed cutting-edge technology to develop an exceptional AI mobile app that goes beyond conventional solutions. By seamlessly providing immediate business insights, we are poised to revolutionise the corporate landscape.

Our vision is to establish ourselves as the preferred platform for AI-driven decision-making, setting new standards in the industry.‚ÄØWe firmly believe that our state-of-the-art technology empowers organisations to make faster and more intelligent choices.

By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of this transformative movement, shaping the future of intelligent decision-making in remarkable ways.

What sets us apart?


We are an internationally diverse and young team with more than 30 nationalities.
We develop high-quality, beautiful software and thus create sustainable added value for our customers.
We pay competitive salaries and reward performance
We live an open feedback culture so that we can constantly reflect and improve.
We offer flexible remote work with free time management within the projects.
We enjoy new technologies, are open for innovative ideas and foster trial and error principles.
We give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us.
We do cool and fun offsites (e.g. Ibiza. Kitzb√ºhel), and regular casual get-togethers.


About Us

LEARN MORE

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Global Consulting Partner - Madrid




Tech stack: Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist




Our client, one of the most known consultancy companies in the world is looking to expand their Data & Analytics team, bringing some professionals that want to work with the best clients in th emarket.




Our client is looking for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Data Scientists (Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist) to bring their services to the market and help enhance this already successful company!




Successful Data Scientists candidates should be able to demonstrate strong knowledge of: Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes




Training will be provided in any of the technologies you lack, allowing you to turn your technological weaknesses into your greatest strengths!




All Data Scientists positions come with the following benefits:




25 days holiday (plus Public Holidays)
REAL flexibility on how and when you work
Allowance for trainings/certifications/conferences
Insurance
Private medical




Location: Madrid, Spain / Hybrid Working




Salary: 49k for Seniors and above 50k for managers (with 20% bonus)




InterEx Group are Experts in Data, ERP and CRM, we are committed to supporting your career progression!

Title: MLOps / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NTT DATA is the 6th biggest IT Service Company in the world with more than 100.000 professionals and a turnover of more than 15 billion euros.




We at NTT DATA Spain make the difference by being close to our clients, exceeding expectations, managing proactively our projects and customers and focusing on quality and selecting employees with the right mindset to make our company grow. The Group has the ambitious goal to position within the TOP 3 worldwide. We have been awarded Best Place to work in Spain for 4 consecutive years.




MLOps practices are both a strategic bet and a fast-growing initiative and thereby we are currently looking for a Data & Intelligence CoE LEADER. The position can be based in Spain Barcelona, even if the geographical scope is Europe. The desirable characteristics are:




What are we looking for?




We are seeking a ML Engineer to our team to take on the technical design and implementation in projects within the scope of our Data & Intelligence CoE, working in initiatives for top-tier organizations.




We are looking for a professional who brings his knowledge and experience in artificial intelligence focused on:




Defining and implementing technical solutions related to AI Platform framework/methodology.
Building AI Platforms aligned with the logical version defined in high-level architecture designs. Being a cloud-native, hybrid or on-premises environment.
Building CI/CD pipelines to orchestrate the MLOps life cycle aligned with client objectives and architecture requisites.
Contribute to the standardization of methodologies for development, training, deploying, inference and monitor of AI use cases.
Facing challenges related to MLOps practices, provide resources and tools for Data Scientist, give them flexibility for model development and robust methodology to allow its productivization, train models in an unattended way, monitorize the model performance and generate retrain alarms.




What will you be accountable for?




Your responsibilities around our artificial intelligence services will be focused on the following fields of action:




Project execution: ensuring the achievement of technical milestones in terms of effectiveness, efficiency and customer satisfaction. Identifying resources needed to do so while ensuring proper management of time, risk and quality.
Development of IaC scripts and pipelines to automate management and deployment of AI Platforms.
Development of CI/CD pipelines leveraging model development industrialization.
Development of custom software integrations to integrate external systems with the AI Platform.
Technical decision making.







Why would we want to meet you?




We want to meet you if:




You have 3 or more years of experience with AI-related projects.
You have experience working with IaC (CDK, Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
You have experience working with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.)
You have strong coding skills in any of the most well-known Object-Oriented languages: Python, Java, C#, etc.
You have worked with artificial intelligence in a startup, large company or academic environment helping Data Scientist to deploy their work in production.
You are oriented to achieving high quality results and continuously improving.
You are committed to transmitting knowledge to the entire team.




We will positively value:




Experience with MLOps tools and frameworks, either from the Open-Source community or from a specific cloud provider.
Building CI/CD pipelines in the context of artificial intelligence.
Software design patterns knowledge.
Data Engineering skills and knowledge.
Experience with model and data monitoring.
IAM knowledge (users, groups, roles, permissions, etc.)




What do we offer?




We propose:




To work on projects for leading companies in Spanish and European market.
To be involved in high priority projects with visibility to senior leadership
To apply the latest technical innovations in artificial intelligence platforms in AWS.
To attend and give conferences.
To join the team of a consolidated multinational such as NTT Data, which shares with you its professional interests and enjoys applying artificial intelligence in large companies and public agencies.
A competitive salary according to provided experience.
A career path that ensures your professional development and continuous improvement (language courses, management and professional skill training, technical training and certifications).




If you are interested or would like to have more information, please apply via this advertisement.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job description: The Opportunity

¬†

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Consultant to join our Order to Cash Business Process Expert Team.¬†

Mission:¬†He/she will help to maximize the performance of the organization through the implementation of processes for improving data quality as well as reporting and analytics tools and processes in Order to Cash. This will include analyzing user and data requirements, and procedures and problems to automate or improve data flows and systems. It will also include reviewing existing system and data capabilities, and workflow and process limitations.

What you'll get to do

¬†Responsibilities:¬†

Analyze, validate and document reporting and analytics business requirements, processes and business rules to drive business solutions.
Support technology design and re-design activities through interpretation and clarification of business requirements and processes and assess impacts of changes to other functional processes and systems.
Lead and/or assist with the creation of business cases, ROIs, and other project related documentation, as required, with input from key business stakeholders
Investigate and analyze opportunities to help improve data quality and business and reporting and analytics applications.
Coordinate, support and help business users resolve day-to-day support issues including data, application software and operational systems.
Assist and support project teams and business representatives throughout projects
Manage projects or processes with limited oversight.

¬†

We'd love to meet you if you have

¬†

Experience and Qualifications¬†

Successfully completed degree in Data Science, Information technology, Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
Experience as a data analyst in the use of process mining tools will be a plus.
Very good communication skills.
Must also have excellent computer skills in the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports, for departmental heads/management, senior data analytics management, and key stakeholders.
Structured, accurate and responsible way of working.
Analytical and solution-oriented thinking skills.
Excellent English skills.

¬†

A few things you'll love about us
An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
A range of learning and development opportunities
An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
A competitive compensation & benefits package
Show more
HTML:
Job description: The Opportunity

 

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Consultant to join our Order to Cash Business Process Expert Team. 

Mission: He/she will help to maximize the performance of the organization through the implementation of processes for improving data quality as well as reporting and analytics tools and processes in Order to Cash. This will include analyzing user and data requirements, and procedures and problems to automate or improve data flows and systems. It will also include reviewing existing system and data capabilities, and workflow and process limitations.

What you'll get to do

 Responsibilities: 

  • Analyze, validate and document reporting and analytics business requirements, processes and business rules to drive business solutions.
  • Support technology design and re-design activities through interpretation and clarification of business requirements and processes and assess impacts of changes to other functional processes and systems.
  • Lead and/or assist with the creation of business cases, ROIs, and other project related documentation, as required, with input from key business stakeholders
  • Investigate and analyze opportunities to help improve data quality and business and reporting and analytics applications.
  • Coordinate, support and help business users resolve day-to-day support issues including data, application software and operational systems.
  • Assist and support project teams and business representatives throughout projects
  • Manage projects or processes with limited oversight.

 

We'd love to meet you if you have

 

Experience and Qualifications 

  • Successfully completed degree in Data Science, Information technology, Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
  • Experience as a data analyst in the use of process mining tools will be a plus.
  • Very good communication skills.
  • Must also have excellent computer skills in the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports, for departmental heads/management, senior data analytics management, and key stakeholders.
  • Structured, accurate and responsible way of working.
  • Analytical and solution-oriented thinking skills.
  • Excellent English skills.

 

A few things you'll love about us
  • An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
  • A range of learning and development opportunities
  • An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
  • A competitive compensation & benefits package

Title: AI Researcher (100% Remote - Spain)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we‚Äôre not just building products, we‚Äôre pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses‚Äîfrom exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs‚Äîto seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world‚Äôs most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that‚Äôs just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you‚Äôre passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We‚Äôve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: Data Scientist (R&D focus)
Description:
At Capitole, we believe that AI Innovation is at the core of every great product.




We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Data Scientist with a strong research background and a passion for product research and development. This role is perfect for someone who thrives on solving complex problems, has a track record of impactful research publications, and excels in communicating technical insights to diverse audiences.




You will be part of the newly formed R&D Lab @ Capitole, where we are looking to bring true AI innovation into the DNA of the company.üöÄ




What You‚Äôll Do üí™




Conduct advanced research on AI topics to uncover novel methodologies that are impactful in many areas. This knowledge should be transformed into actionable insights that inform product development and strategy.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data science solutions into products.
We are, at the core, an R&D department, so publishing research in high-impact journals, presenting findings at conferences and writing down reports is part of the equation. This also includes submitting preprints to noticeable archives.
Clearly communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Partner with ML Engineers and other developers to deploy solutions and ensure their scalability and robustness.
Develop the AI guts moonshot POCs following best practice standards.







What We‚Äôre Looking For: üß©




PhD in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven track record of research publications in top-tier journals or conferences.
Being able to understand and potentially translate equations and pseudo-code found in research papers into code
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages, with experience in frameworks like TensorFlow, scikit-learn, Llama-index, etc.
Proficiency in data visualization and storytelling.
Exceptional communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Experience working on product development teams or delivering data science solutions that have been successfully implemented.
Fluent in Spanish and in English.
You live in Barcelona or surroundings.







Why choose Capitole? ‚ú®




Competitive Salary: Receive a competitive salary, reflecting our commitment to recognizing and rewarding your valuable contributions.
Access to different wellness centers üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Free health insurance for you ü•º
Hybrid Work Format: Embrace flexibility with a blend of home and office, including a rooftop in the heart of the city. üè°
Qaterly Teambuildings and Afterwork Events at our Capitole Barüçª
Training budget: 1200‚Ç¨ üìö







If you want to know more about our culture, visit the follow link! üëâ https://youtu.be/EXYs1-pIi_g?si=bDXyX8PqimC-7gn-




Ready to take your skills to the next level? This is your chance to shine! üåü Do not hesitate and apply right now! We can‚Äôt wait to meet you!

Title: DATA SCIENTIST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER - Energy and Food
Description:
EURECAT

Eurecat is the main Research & Technology Organisation in Catalonia and the second largest private research organization in southern Europe. It brings together the experience of more than 700 professionals and provides services to more than 2,000 companies. Applied R&D, technological services, highly specialized training, technological consultancy or valorisation and exploitation of industrial property are some of the services that Eurecat offers for both large and small and medium-sized enterprises in all sectors. The technology centre participates in more than 200 large national and international consortium projects of high strategic R&I and has 181 patents and 10 spin-offs. The added value provided by Eurecat accelerates innovation, reduces spending on scientific and technological infrastructures, reduces risks and provides specialized knowledge tailored to each company.

Job Description

Are you ready to embark on a challenging journey of discovering and applying novel Machine Learning and AI-driven solutions in trending topics including energy optimization in microgrids with renewable energies and electric vehicle, interoperable digital twins for advanced monitoring and management of assets or novel technologies to contribute to better practices in the agricultural sector?

The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of EURECAT is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist and Machine Learning engineer to help us pave the way in digitalization and development of new technologies for creating a smarter and more sustainable future.

Responsabilities

As a valued member of our team, your role encompasses several critical dimensions:


Design and implement solutions based on mathematical algorithms and classical ML: supervised and unsupervised models, regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, optimization, recommendation systems, time series, semi-supervised learning, etc.
Design and implement solutions based on Deep Learning techniques like Recurrent Neural Networks and Autoencoders.
Research innovative techniques and methods in the field of artificial intelligence to stay up-to-date with new trends.
Practical application and experimentation of state-of-the-art techniques in projects and challenges to be developed.
Global Impact: Collaborate on scientific publications, sharing your insights with the wider research community.
Tailored Growth: We recognize your unique strengths and interests. Your responsibilities will evolve accordingly, fostering personalized development within our team.
Project Leadership: As you grow and the projects unfold, your adept project management skills will steer us toward success.


WHAT EURECAT CAN OFFER YOU?

Our Group Is Specialized In Applied Research And Development On ML And AI Solutions. The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit Of Eurecat Develops Innovative Solutions (algorithms, Methods, Platforms) Based On a Combination Of Artificial Intelligence And Knowledge Management Technologies, Especially For The Industrial, Energy And Sustainability Sectors. We Have Over 12 Years Of Experience Pushing The Adoption Of State-of-the-art AI And ML Solutions For Our Private Customers As Well As For Relevant European Research Projects! Check Out Our Portfolio

Applied Artificial Intelligence - Eurecat (applied-artificial-intelligence-eurecat.github.io)

Applied Artificial Intelligence Eurecat Technological Centre

And ‚Ä¶


Permanent contract
Hybrid work (3 home office/2 work in the office)
Flexible Schedule
Shorter workday on Friday and Summer Schedule
Flexible remuneration package (health insurance, transport, lunch, studies - training and kindergarten)
Eurecat workers can join the Eurecat Academy courses
Eurecat workers can attend to our weekly thematic sessions to be aware of Eurecat areas of knowledge.
Language‚Äôs training (English, Catalan and Spanish)


Please note that interviews for the selection process will continue in September.

Requirements


Passion for DataScience and ML.
Basic studies: Physics, Math, Energy engineering, Agronomy, Forestry engineering.
Superior studies: MSc or equivalent in ML, AI, Computer Vision, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, with a track record of applying AI techniques.
Proficiency in Python and knowledge of basic libraries like Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, SciPy.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization and its implementation in python with libraries like Pyomo or PuLP.
Valuable knowledge in some deep learning libraries like Keras, PyTorch and Tensorflow.
Open minded and multidisciplinary: Eager to learn new domains.
Dynamic communication skills, allowing you to effectively convey complex ideas and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
A readiness to travel when needed, embracing opportunities to connect with clients, partners, and collaborators worldwide.
Languages: English, Catalan, Spanish

Join Capgemini Invent, the strategic consulting and digital transformation powerhouse of the Capgemini Group, where innovation meets opportunity.

Industries across the board are undergoing unprecedented change, driven by Digital Transformation and Big Data technologies. From improving operational efficiency and product lifecycle management to enabling predictive solutions and advanced analytics, we empower organizations to leverage data as a strategic asset, driving innovation, smarter decision-making, and value creation.




What will you do in your day-to-day?

üîπ Strategic mindset and oriented towards delivering results

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Senior) Machine Learning Engineer (LLM) - AI Solutions - San Sebastian, Spain




We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Large Language Models (LLMs) to design and optimize cutting-edge AI solutions. In this role, you will work on challenging projects that address real-world issues, leveraging advanced AI and quantum-inspired technologies.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement compression techniques for LLMs to improve efficiency and solve domain-specific challenges.
Evaluate, fine-tune, and optimize LLMs for enhanced performance, accuracy, and robustness.
Analyze model strengths and weaknesses, proposing and implementing improvements.
Document development processes and mentor junior team members to foster continuous learning.
Stay current with advancements in LLMs and recommend relevant tools and techniques.




Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. in AI, Computer Science, or related fields.
3+ years‚Äô experience with deep learning models; 1+ year hands-on with LLMs/Transformers (e.g., HuggingFace, PyTorch).
Strong foundation in deep learning, neural networks, and GPU architectures.
Proficiency in Python, cloud platforms (e.g., AWS), and containerization (e.g., Docker).
Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills; research publications are a plus.




This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the future of AI, tackling complex challenges in an innovative and collaborative environment.




Complete our Compensation and Benefits in Niche Tech Industries Survey here: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/6MXGW39




By applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice https://eu-recruit.com/about-us/privacy-notice/

Title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)
Description:
Job Reference

88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Position

Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

Closing Date

Monday, 24 March, 2025

Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Job title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputaci√≥n (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences.

The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios.

This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO. It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities.

This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists. The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data. The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects.

Key Duties


Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios.
Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines.
Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration.
Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments.
Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements.
Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting.


Requirements


Education
Bachelor or Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.
Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn.
Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures.
Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets.
Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment.
Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience
Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr).
Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows.
Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/ or distributed training using Dask.
Understanding of climate and weather models.
Competences
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows.
Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment.
Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings.
Proficiency in written and spoken English.

Conditions


The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department
We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures
Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
Starting date: 01/03/2025


Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:


A full CV in English including contact details
A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered.


Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposici√≥n"). The recruitment process consists of two phases:


Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position. - 40 points
Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated. - 60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.


The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact recruitment@bsc.es.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

For more information follow this link
