Title: Professional Internship - AI
HTML:
VORTEX-CoLab is a growing collaborative laboratory that brings together academia and industry partners in an innovation framework to drive technology transfer in the areas of cyber-physical systems and cybersecurity. We are embarking on a journey that combines cutting-edge research and agile market solutions to create world-class products with the highest safety guarantees.


WHO?


We are looking for master‚Äôs degree students in the fields of Computer Science and Data Science with technical skills and enthusiasm to join our team. The ideal profile includes:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science - Data Science;
  • Knowledge in:

- Data pre-processing;

- Development of Machine Learning models;

- Statistical analysis;

- Scripting;

- Frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.


WHAT?


As an intern at VORTEX-CoLab, you will:

  • Contribute to the work of the innovation team;
  • Work within the Scrum methodology (training provided);
  • Develop and train AI models, focusing on GenAI, for optimization in networks and embedded applications.


OBJECTIVES TO ACHIEVE


  • Develop skills in data science and machine learning applied to embedded environments;
  • Participate in innovation projects that directly impact market solutions;
  • Actively collaborate in the team, contributing to the development of GenAI model


WHY?


If your goal is to work in an applied research and cutting-edge development environment, focusing on innovation in AI and GenAI technologies, this is a unique opportunity. Here, you will:

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary and motivated team;
  • Gain access to training in agile methodologies and emerging technologies;
  • Develop solutions applicable to a fast-evolving market.


At VORTEX-CoLab, we combine innovative minds, academic insights, and a business mindset to transform technological challenges into world-class solutions. If you are ready to be part of this challenge, we look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Junior Developer (Recent Graduate)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Junior Developer (Recent Graduate) for a hybrid project based in Porto Lisbon (2x/Week).




Scope: The Quantitative Research - Compute team is responsible for all computational aspects of QR teams within Global Markets. It is a transversal team whose main mandates include enforcing Computer Science best practices, maintaining and enhancing the QR pricing libraries, and building and supporting tools based on these libraries.




Responsibilities:

Maintain and enhance a large software solution, following the team‚Äôs best practices.
Maintain and manage the computational infrastructure required to build and test such solution, in coordination with the rest of the Compute team.
Eliminate technical obsolescence and drive efforts to ensure application performance.




Requirements:

Master degree (or higher) in Computer Science or any other science/engineering field with a strong interest in computer science.
Good understanding of Computer Science concepts: algorithms, complexity, distributed computation, etc.
Experience with an interpreted language (e.g., Python, JavaScript).
Experience with a compiled language (e.g., C++, C#, Java).
Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is mandatory.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/JD.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Gen AI Developer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a Gen AI Developer. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality.

This position is Hybrid in Porto. (3 days/week at the office)

Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Lead the development of Generative AI solutions from proof of concept to deployment, ensuring high-quality standards through best practices, testing, validation, and performance evaluation.
Guide and mentor junior developers throughout the AI development lifecycle, fostering collaboration and ensuring high-quality deliverables.
Engage with business stakeholders to define the technical direction of AI projects and align them with business needs.
Support the deployment of AI models in production environments, ensuring continuous monitoring, optimization, and updates.
Collaborate with software developers, MLOps, and DevOps teams to seamlessly integrate AI modules into scalable applications.


Requirements For The Role


Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong expertise in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Generative AI.
At least 5 years of experience in full-stack machine learning, from conception to deployment, focusing on modular and scalable architectures.
Experience in developing and deploying LLM-based solutions is highly valued.
Proficiency in Python and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and LangChain.
Hands-on experience with cloud services, particularly Azure or AWS.
Familiarity with services such as API Gateway, Lambda, ECS, DynamoDB, OpenAI, and BedRock is a plus.
Experience in building and integrating RESTful APIs and microservices.
Strong knowledge of software engineering best practices, including code reviews, automated testing, version control (Git), and Agile methodologies.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and mentoring skills..
A team player with a collaborative mindset.
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Junior Developer (Recent Graduate)
Description:
Direct message the job poster from Decskill

Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:

Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.

Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.

Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.

We are looking for a Junior Developer (Recent Graduate) for a hybrid project based in Porto Lisbon (2x/Week).

Scope: The Quantitative Research - Compute team is responsible for all computational aspects of QR teams within Global Markets. It is a transversal team whose main mandates include enforcing Computer Science best practices, maintaining and enhancing the QR pricing libraries, and building and supporting tools based on these libraries.

Responsibilities: Maintain and enhance a large software solution, following the team's best practices.Maintain and manage the computational infrastructure required to build and test such solution, in coordination with the rest of the Compute team.Eliminate technical obsolescence and drive efforts to ensure application performance.Requirements: Master degree (or higher) in Computer Science or any other science/engineering field with a strong interest in computer science.Good understanding of Computer Science concepts: algorithms, complexity, distributed computation, etc.Experience with a compiled language (e.g., C++, C#, Java).Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is mandatory.If you're interested in this job please send your CV to ****** with reference CN/JD.

Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Seniority levelAssociate

Employment typeFull-time

Job functionInformation Technology

IndustriesIT Services and IT Consulting

Title: Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, AI/ML & Analytics
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on an end-to-end data analytics and mlops solution composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on workflow, ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. Your team will own a solution from the analytics and machine learning space, and integrate with the solutions from other teams to build the world's best end-to-end data platform. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers; we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

Location: This initiative spans many teams that are home-based and in multiple time zones. We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hourse! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

What your day will look like


Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing
Work with both Kubernetes and machine-oriented open source applications
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions


What we are looking for in you


Professional or academic software delivery using Python
Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


Additional Skills That Would Be Nice To Have



The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.


Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions for the cloud.
Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Working knowledge of cloud computing
Passionate about software quality and testing
Experience working on an open source project


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Title: Mid Python Developer
Description:
Visma is not just your average company ‚Äì¬†we're a leading Scandinavian player in the mission-critical business software scene, making a real impact. Picture us as the folks who find, build, and deliver software that genuinely makes life better for millions of people worldwide.




Our software? It's the magic wand that simplifies and automates those tricky work processes, giving folks the freedom to enjoy their everyday lives a bit more. Now, here's the cool part ‚Äì Visma isn't just a company; it's a dynamic network of go-getters, each running their show with that startup flair, unique personality, and strong leadership.




What sets us apart? Well, each of our companies gets to do its thing ‚Äì we call it business autonomy. It's like a secret sauce that keeps our growth game strong. Our mission is simple but powerful:¬†we want to empower people by making complex tasks easy. Looking forward, we're not just tech enthusiasts; we're on a mission to shape the future of society through our tech wizardry.




About the product

Visma acquired a Dutch product focused on e-Health.¬†By making intelligent, inspiring and connecting psychology available on demand to everyone, we want to give people the power to create a mentally strong existence.




What you bring to the table

+3 years of Python experience
Design, implement and maintain system components
Work relentlessly towards outstanding code, practicing quality shift left such as TDD/BDD while consistently ensure quality test coverage and automation
Design, create, document external RESTful APIs compliant with international healthcare standards
Drive continuous improvement to optimise the way of working, unafraid of change
Take responsibility from design to operation, with lifecycle management and practical problem solving skills to ensure the team can be proud of delivering great work




What we expect from you

Experience as a software developer
Experience with Python framework
Applicable knowledge of various cloud related services
Experience in agile environments with cross-functional teams is beneficial
Experience with CI/CD, observability, GitOps are beneficial
You have a work permit for working in Portugal*




What you can expect from us

In our nordic-inspired work environment, we appreciate flexibility, autonomy, and a collaborative spirit. If you're someone who enjoys getting hands-on, work/life balance, values learning and finds joy in sharing experiences with colleagues.. you're in the right place!

We love that you bring your ideas to the table: You will be part of a culture that favors experiments and value initiative, so it‚Äôs easy to get your ideas heard.
Make an impact from day 1: We want you to experience meaning as much as you experience mastery through creating value that impacts people's everyday lives. And you get to influence how to go about creating that value with full autonomy of your work.
Flexibility at all stages of life: Work is an important part of life. Yet, we know that you are much more than your job. We make room for people at all stages of life.
We invest in your competence: When you step into Visma, opportunities from A-Z awaits. You will be met by engaged leaders that care for and support you, and take part to competence sharing and learning networks across Visma within.
Above all, we are a team: Team spirit is key for us to deliver on our promises to people and society, but most importantly; to form a culture where people support and care for each other as much as we have tons of fun together.




We celebrate a culture where everyone's uniqueness contributes to our collective success. Feel free to share a bit about yourself, your interests and what makes you thrive both at work and in life. We're looking forward to learning more about you!




*To comply with local employment laws, this position is open only to individuals who have the legal right to work in Portugal. Candidates must have a valid work permit or authorization to work in Portugal without employer-sponsored visas.

Title: Front-End Engineer (React)
Description:
Pixelmatters is a digital product studio. We're a team of strategists, designers and engineers creating top-quality digital products.

Our mission is to empower businesses to achieve their full potential by creating top-quality digital products while fostering great relationships along the way. We envision a world where great user experience is the norm, not the exception, inspiring businesses and people to be at their best.

We're looking for you, a meticulous, curious, and adaptable senior Front-End Engineer with the ability to translate pixels into code. You can work closely with Product Owners, Designers and other Engineers. On top of this, you are a cooperative person, supporting and promoting knowledge sharing is part of your way of doing things.

Your role will focus on designing, testing, and implementing user-facing software applications, with a strong emphasis on front-end development. For this reason, it's expected that you're comfortable with front-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries.

Some of your day-to-day tasks will include building responsive and interactive user interfaces, collaborating on design decisions, optimizing performance, ensuring cross-browser compatibility, and writing tests for front-end components.

Requirements


At least 4 years of experience as a Front-End Engineer
Familiar with React framework
Experience with HTML5, CSS3 and Typescript
Familiarity with Component-Driven Design and using tools like Storybook to build and test components in isolation
Familiar with version control systems such as Git
Good understanding of English and Portuguese (written and spoken)
Understanding of cross-browser and device compatibility issues and ways to work around them
Ability to integrate with web services (RESTful APIs, JSON, and GraphQL)



It would be awesome if you also have...


Understanding of Vite as a front-end build tool, particularly in React and TypeScript environments
Expertise in unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests with frameworks such as Jest, React Testing Library, and Playwright to ensure robustness and maintainability of code



Benefits


Quality-driven, inspiring and collaborative work environment
Benefits package, including health insurance
We have an office located at Porto's downtown, while continuing to back our "Remote as default, Office as an option" policy



Compensation


The salary range from this role is between ‚Ç¨32,426.00 to ‚Ç¨61,126.00 annual gross, which includes meal, vacation and Xmas allowances

Title: Software Developer (Ruby on Rails)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!




@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stand out, for those who always want to be better and fight for it, and for those who have the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.




At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Software Developer

Seniority: MID (3+ years)

Title: Data Science Mastermind
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for bright Data Science Masterminds‚ÄØto join our team

At Critical TechWorks, our Data Scientists play a pivotal role in steering the future of mobility. With a blend of technology, creativity, and analytical prowess, you will be instrumental in unlocking insights from vast data, driving innovation in areas across the whole universe of the automotive industry. If you are passionate about harnessing data to shape the future of automotive experiences, this is where your journey begins.


Advanced Statistical Analysis: Apply your expertise in statistics to analyze complex datasets, uncovering patterns and insights that inform key decisions.
Machine Learning Model Development: Design and refine machine learning models, enhancing the capabilities and intelligence of BMW's systems.
Data Visualization and Communication: Craft compelling visualizations and convey findings to stakeholders, translating complex data into actionable insights.
Experimentation and A/B Testing: Lead rigorous testing to evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and approaches, ensuring continuous improvement.
Collaborative Solution Design: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers and product visionaries, to design data-driven solutions that align with strategic objectives.


Whatever you‚Äôre working on, here‚Äôs the lowdown on the technical skills you‚Äôre likely to have:


At least 3 years of experience in technical software engineering, good scripting, and programming skills with at least one programming language (Python, Scala) and proficiency with data science libraries (e.g. Pandas, Numpy, matplotlib, seaborn, sklearn).
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL).
Experience working with public cloud platforms, especially AWS, and according to technologies and services is a plus (e.g. Apache Spark/ AWS glue, Apache HIVE/ AWS Athena, Jupyter/ AWS Sagemaker, ML-LIB).
Experience with IaC such as Terraform is a plus.
Expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, and data mining.
Advanced experience in applied statistics, Machine Learning, or related fields.
Experience in analyzing and visualizing complex statistical data is a big plus.
Experience in automotive‚ÄØdata‚ÄØprocessing /‚ÄØdata‚ÄØscience‚ÄØis a big plus.


CTW's Daily Toolkit

Skills

Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Data Scientists must also possess the following:


Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.
Use state of the art DevOps quality practices and tools such as Continuous Integration /Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to build, analyse, perform automated testing and deployment processes, to ensure a streamlined and reliable development workflow.
Run and operate developed software inside and outside working hours if needed, to provide high quality software services (extra compensation will be applicable).
Be available to travel abroad for short periods, as required to support all the phases of the product development cycle when needed.
Have excellent English oral and written skills. German communication skills will be a plus.


Who we are

Critical TechWorks seeks a distinct and treasured corporate culture, that is very much our own. This means:


Growth and Innovation: Be a key player in shaping the future of mobility through innovative ideas.
Engineering Excellence: Immerse yourself in an environment valuing engineering process, where we create, innovate, lead, and make a tangible impact.
Autonomy and Collaboration: Thrive in a culture that blends autonomy with teamwork, contributing to groundbreaking developments.
Continuous Learning: Embrace constant skill enhancement in a dynamic workplace, where your contributions impact cutting-edge technology projects.


Join Critical TechWorks on our journey of innovation, excellence, and redefining the future of motion, one product at a time.

Notice: Apply to only one job; our Talent Team will analyze your profile and consider you for all relevant positions.

At Critical Techworks we are creating an inclusive culture that values our people‚Äôs different viewpoints and experiences, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, ethnicity, religion, or disability.

Critical TechWorks is a joint venture to lead the future of motion. Established in 2018, Critical TechWorks is a company formed as a result of a partnership between BMW Group and Critical Software. Critical TechWorks is exclusively put together to support BMW in building software for its future driving machines.

Title: Automation Solutions Specialist
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.
Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.



At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.
We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.
We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.
We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.



Become a part of our story.
We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.





Job Description



Your Mission



We‚Äôre seeking a hands-on Automation Solutions Specialist to optimise our internal processes and workflows. Collaborating with Product Managers (particularly those overseeing CR and sales tools) and Operations leaders, you will design and implement solutions that enhance how we serve our customers. This involves everything from automating logistics and supply-chain notifications to integrating our CRM platforms seamlessly with internal systems.



Key Responsibilities



Automation Development & Maintenance



Build, test, and deploy automation workflows, primarily using Workato (or comparable platforms).



Create scripts (e.g. Python, JavaScript) to handle scenarios beyond standard connectors or integrations.



Systems Integration & Data Synchronisation



Integrate and synchronise systems (HubSpot, Zendesk, Jira, etc.) to ensure accurate data flow and minimal manual intervention.



Manage logistics-related processes, including real-time notifications and communications around deliveries or status updates.



Data Handling & Analysis



Process large Excel datasets (>10k rows) in data frames for reporting, visualisation, and trend analysis.



Apply basic statistical methods (means, medians, standard deviations) to identify efficiencies and inform decision-making.



Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement



Work closely with operational leaders and agents in multiple locations, gathering requirements and translating them into actionable automation proposals.



Conduct occasional presentations or demos of automation solutions, though the primary focus is hands-on execution.



Continuous Improvement & Innovation



Regularly assess existing processes for opportunities to automate and improve.



Leverage AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) to expedite coding, debugging, and prototyping solutions.



Security & Compliance Awareness



Ensure automations follow essential data security and privacy best practices.



Liaise with relevant teams on compliance considerations as needed (e.g., data privacy regulations).



Leadership & Growth



Guide less experienced team members or peers in best practices for automation.



Potentially lead a small team of automation specialists as the function expands.





Qualifications



Technical Proficiency



iPaaS Experience: Hands-on knowledge of Workato or a similar platform.



Coding/Scripting: Strong ability to write and troubleshoot scripts in Python, JavaScript, or a similar language.



API Integrations: Familiar with RESTful APIs, JSON payloads, and token-based authorisations.



Data Handling



Proficient in using spreadsheets, data frames, and basic data visualisation tools.



Able to handle medium-large data sets (tens of thousands of rows) efficiently.



Tools & Platforms



Comfortable working with Jira, HubSpot, Zendesk, and other CRMs or ticketing systems.



Advantageous to have experience building browser-based extensions or ‚Äúhacky‚Äù integrations for unique use cases.



Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills



Demonstrable track record of spotting automation opportunities and delivering workable, tested solutions.



Capable of basic statistical calculations to inform operational decisions.



Communication & Collaboration



Able to translate business needs into technical solutions and convey progress to non-technical stakeholders concisely.



Fluent written and spoken English; other languages a plus.



Professional Experience



Previous experience in a role heavily focused on automation, systems integration, or process engineering.



Exposure to operational logistics or supply-chain systems is beneficial but not mandatory.



Mindset & Growth



Motivated to explore new technologies, including AI tools, to enhance productivity.



Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with evolving priorities.





Additional Information



The Perks



We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

    • Demonstrable track record of spotting automation opportunities and delivering workable, tested solutions.

    • Capable of basic statistical calculations to inform operational decisions.

    • Able to translate business needs into technical solutions and convey progress to non-technical stakeholders concisely.

    • Fluent written and spoken English; other languages a plus.

    • Previous experience in a role heavily focused on automation, systems integration, or process engineering.

    • Motivated to explore new technologies, including AI tools, to enhance productivity.

Additional Information

The Perks

  • We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
  • Health Insurance;
  • Meal Allowance;
  • 25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);

  • Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
  • Office snacks every day;

Title: Full-Stack Engineer
Description:
Pixelmatters is a digital product studio. We're a team of strategists, designers and engineers creating top-quality digital products.

Our mission is to empower businesses to achieve their full potential by creating top-quality digital products while fostering great relationships along the way. We envision a world where great user experience is the norm, not the exception, inspiring businesses and people to be at their best.

We're looking for you, a meticulous, curious and adaptable mid to senior Full-Stack Engineer, who has the ability to develop scalable software solutions that cater to both user experience and functionality. On top of this, you are a cooperative person, supporting and promoting knowledge sharing is part of your way of doing things.

Your role will focus on designing, testing, and implementing software applications, and you will be involved in all stages and all areas of software development, from front-end to back-end. For this reason, it's expected that you're comfortable with both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries.

Some of your day-to-day tasks will include building user-facing products, designing and implementing databases and APIs, pipelines, managing infrastructure and writing tests.

Requirements


At least 4 years of experience as a Full-Stack Engineer or relevant experience as a Front-end or Back-end Engineer
Proficiency with HTML5 and CSS3
Proficiency in JavaScript-based frameworks such as React and Node.js, or strong experience with Python
Experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases, such as PostgreSQL, Redis, or MongoDB
Experience integrating multiple third-party APIs and web services
Strong understanding of unit testing and testing principles
Familiarity with version control systems such as Git
Excellent understanding of English and Portuguese (written and spoken)



It would be awesome if you also have...


Experience working with Content Delivery Networks (CDNs)
Familiarity with WebSockets and message brokers
Experience with test automation frameworks and tools



Benefits


Quality-driven, inspiring, and collaborative work environment
Competitive salary and benefits, including health insurance
We have an office located at Porto's downtown, while continuing to back our "Remote as default, Office as an option" policy



Compensation


The salary range from this role is between ‚Ç¨32,426.00 to ‚Ç¨61,126.00 annual gross which includes meal, vacation, and Xmas allowance.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer, Ceph & Distributed Storage
Description:
The role of a Software Engineer, Ceph & Distributed Storage at Canonical

As a software engineer at Canonical, you have a key role in the success of Ubuntu, our partners, customers, and the larger Ubuntu community. Your primary responsibility is to your team - contributing toward objectives, continuously improving, and striving to be a vital part of a healthy, high-performing team. At Canonical, you will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

As part of Cloud Engineering, you'll be building modeling software to drive systems such as OpenStack, Ceph, and Kubernetes with a focus on distributed storage and Ceph. You'll be engineering solutions to scale in production, working with our field teams to ensure we're meeting the needs of customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology.

Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.

This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time.

Location: This role will be based remotely in EMEA or the Americas regions

What your day will look like


Write high quality, rigorously designed Python and Golang software
Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
Contribute to technical documentation that define best practices for authoring high quality operators
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Develop and maintain software for delivery, operations and life-cycle management of Ceph storage


What we are looking for in you


You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have experience with writing modern, maintainable Python
You have experience with Ceph storage
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Linux, Kubernetes, Public cloud, OpenStack, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, Debian packaging
An exceptional academic track record from both high school and preferably university
Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring


Experience operating Ceph clusters in production
Experience with open source distributed storage such as Gluster, Minio, Mayastor or similar


What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Junior Java Developer
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We seek a Junior Java Developer (1.5+ year of experience in Java) willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team, working in a hybrid model with 2 days per week on-site in Porto.




Are you the one?




1.5+ year of experience in Java.
Experience with JPA/Hibernate.
Experience working with relational databases.
Experience with the following technologies: Spring (Boot, MVC, Batch), Java EE (CDI, RestEasy), JBoss, Maven.
Experience using Git and Jenkins.
Experience with Unit testing using Junit/Mockito, or other testing libraries.
Knowledge of JSF (nice to have).
Experience developing RESTful web services (writing APIs code, documenting and some experience with an API gateway solution).
Experience working with an MQ solution (RabbitMQ, IBM MQ) and JMS (nice to have).
Good Knowledge of software architecture and design related topics (SOLID Principles, Design Patterns, etc).
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Knowledge of SQL.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others ‚Äì and an ability to turn ideas into concrete things.
English fluency (mandatory).




We believe we are the ones to, by:




Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.




Oh‚Ä¶ and by the way, we also have:




Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to catarina.niza@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.




At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Intermediate Site Reliability Engineer - OP01669
Description:
üü¢ Join Dev.Pro - a US-based outsourcing software development company that has been delivering exceptional software experience to clients since 2011.

We invite a reliable and disciplined IT Specialist who understands the challenges and demands of the SRE role to join our IT Department at Dev.Pro - a company with high-scale projects in POS, restaurant business, healthcare, fintech, and other domains. As part of our SRE team, you'll support both our company and clients' environments, demonstrating initiative, attention to detail, quick learning abilities, and strong communication skills.

üü© What's in it for you:


Join a dynamic IT company with 900+ global specialists and experience a unique U.S. business culture
Work with a modern tech stack (AWS, GCP, Docker, Ansible, etc.), enhancing your expertise in cloud, automation, and infrastructure
Gain valuable hands-on skills that will allow you to explore DevOps roles in the future



‚úÖ Is that you?


Strong troubleshooting skills in high-demand IT environments
Linux (Ubuntu) and Windows server administration expertise
Experience with web servers (Apache, NGINX)
Proficiency in SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL)
Strong scripting skills in Bash and/or Python
Experience with AWS
Experience with Ansible and Puppet for configuration management and automation
Familiarity with Git
Understanding of networking concepts and protocols (OSI model, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, NAT, VLAN, routing, 802.11 standards, SSH, HTTPS, IPsec)
Intermediate English level
Responsibility, clear communication, and proactive visibility within the team



Desirable:


Experience with CI/CD, container orchestration, and IaC (Jenkins, TeamCity, Docker, Terraform)
Familiarity with GCP
Familiarity with tools like Prometheus, ELK Stack, Grafana, and Zabbix
Understanding of security best practices and vulnerabilities
Ability to build and monitor services on production servers



üß©Key Responsibilities And Your Contribution

In this role, you'll help maintain our server infrastructure and support client projects, focusing on automation, monitoring, and system maintenance to provide reliable services for Dev.Pro and its clients.


Maintain the company's on-premises and cloud server infrastructure
Manage, monitor, and optimize network systems, websites, and related services
Automate CI/CD processes and infrastructure with Ansible and Terraform
Monitor systems, troubleshoot issues, and resolve alerts from monitoring tools to address vulnerabilities
Create and maintain clear and comprehensive documentation
Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., process automation, AI) to support infrastructure, deployment, and automation tasks
Provide similar support with infrastructure, deployment, and automation tasks for client projects
Participate in daytime shifts on weekdays, assisting clients with any monitoring alerts or issues



üéæ What's working at Dev.Pro like?

At Dev.Pro, we appreciate your contribution and the value you add to projects. We are a company with an ambitious and creative mindset whose corporate culture is based on respect for diversity and uniqueness, as well as enablement of equal opportunities for all. By joining Dev.Pro, you'll feel what it's like to grow with professionals who support your journey.

‚úÖ Get 30 paid rest days per year to use as holidays/vacation/other on the desired and requested dates

‚úÖ 5 sick leave days, up to 60 days of medical leave, and up to 6 days of leave per year due to family reasons (i.e., wedding/funeral/baby birth)

‚úÖ Get a health insurance package fully compensated by Dev.Pro

‚úÖ Join fun online activities and team-building events

‚úÖ Get continuous remote HR, payroll support, and overtime coverage

‚úÖ Join English/Polish lessons

‚úÖ Grow your expertise with mentorship support and DP University

Our next steps:

‚úÖ Submit a CV in English ‚Äî ‚úÖ Intro call with a Recruiter ‚Äî ‚úÖ Interview ‚Äî ‚úÖ Offer

Interested? Find out more:

üìãHow we work

üíª LinkedIn Page

üìà Our website

üíªIG Page

Title: Data Engineering Associate
Description:
Who We Are




The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




Develop your professional career working with one of the major brands in the fashion industry
Opportunity to accelerate the pace of digitalization & eCommerce growth through advanced technology, business intelligence, and analytics
Driving high-impact insights enhances decision-making across the entire organization
Driving brand equity and digital sales through enhanced digital experiences
Interaction with senior business and eCommerce leaders regularly to drive their business toward impactful change
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team




What You will Do




Data Engineers identify data ingestion opportunities that unlock insights, extract it and organize it in a way that‚Äôs widely available, scalable and that answers any critical use case. You will also team up with data scientists to ensure a constant feed of fresh data into machine learning models and support on the organisation of any performance related metrics and data.
Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building reusable components, frameworks and libraries at scale to support analytics products.
Design, build and launch extremely efficient and reliable data pipelines to move data across several platforms including data warehouses, data lakes, operational systems, online services and real-time systems.
Anticipate, identify and solve issues concerning data management to improve data quality.
Participate in sharing sessions with peers, customers and functional partners and contribute to evangelising data engineering practices.




What You‚Äôll Bring




3+ years of work experience.
Proven experience in software development and practices with at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java or C#).
Proven experience modelling data to discover opportunities and address gaps.
Proven experience in building data pipelines within data ingestion projects using data flows management platforms (e.g., Airflow, Google Cloud Composer, Azure Data Factory).
Ability to work in the English language with strong written and oral communication skills.
Proven experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, Google Cloud Platform and/or AWS)
Proven experience querying massive datasets using Spark, Presto, etc.
Proven experience with designing and implementing real-time pipelines.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Automotive Embedded SW Engineer
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.




Your Role




The architect will be responsible in formulating the product roadmap for customer projects, work with Product Owners and Business Leaders to define the technical product strategy.
The individual will also participate in customer meetings to proactively pitch technical solution from Capgemini AUTOSAR practice.
Do Technical RCA of Problems and Systemic Improvements
Create Software Architecture and review Project Level Technical workflows
Do Project Level Technical Impact Analysis of Changes
Assess and Improve Team Training and Competency
Review design and performance optimization
Review estimates of tasks and functions in projects
Review Technical approach, estimation, technical risks and solution of proposals
Convert customer requirements to software requirements







Your Profile




10+ years of experience in Embedded SW / Automotive domain
Embedded C
Autosar: RTE, BSW, MCAL, CANoe, CANalyzer, CANstress, CAN, UDS, Ethernet, Bootloader Integration
Tools: Vector AUTOSAR stack, DaVinci Configurator and developer

Hybrid work.
